result.execSummary:
The defendant Karl Michael Wierzchowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 8/1/15, cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of civil judgment.  Any remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.

Release for the Day Reporting Center ONLY. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
***Court ORDER GRANTING Defendant's request for release privilege "Electronic Monitoring" only IF participating in DRC.  12/15/14, Judge Stark/***
Consecutive to: to any sentence. Credit for 17 days time served.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.

records.addlTxt:
Per Inter-Office communication received from the House of Correction: Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Secion 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4), signed and filed.
Based upon all the files, records, and proceedings and upon a report submitted to the court by Elizabeth Rowe, Corrections Lieutenant of the House of Correction, the privileges previously granted are cancelled, and the defendant is sentenced to ordinary confinement for the balance of the term heretofore imposed. 
Copies mailed to parties.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge STARK, Br 17, for review. OS

Order, signed and filed. 
The defendant's request for release privileges is granted in part because of his significant progress at the the Day Reporting Center. Defendant may be released for the following: Electronic Monitoring, ONLY IF Participating in Day Reporting Center.
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on the bracelet.

Defendant Karl Michael Wierzchowski in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information. Judgment of conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  
Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center ONLY; credit for 17 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge
Pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 8/1/2015, 
cash bail to apply. Any remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter. 
Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due 
immediately or an entry of civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 6, 2014, received and filed.

Attorney Megan L. Morrisey in court, defendant Karl Michael Wierzchowski not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).  Defendant already has $250.00 posted; must post an additional $500.00 cash for release.  All conditions of bail remain the same.  Case remains set for plea hearing on 8-7-14, 8:30 before Branch 17.
All other conditions of bail remain the same.  Defendant previously posted $250.00.  Balance due is $1,000.00

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 26.

No drugs without a valid prescription
